title: What are the '00s and the '10s decades called? - Quora

response.answer_text: Traditionally, the names of the decades are: 1890s - The Gay Nineties1900s - The Aughties or Noughties1910s - (nothing)1920s - The Roaring Twenties1930s - The Turbulent Thirties, sometimes The Threadbare Thirties 1940s - The Flying Forties, sometimes The Fightin' Forties1950s - The Fabulous (Fab) Fifties, sometimes The Nifty Fifties 1960s - The Swingin' Sixties, sometimes The Psychedelic Sixties1970s - The Disco Era ("accept no imitation"), The 'Me' Decade1980s - The Decade of Decadence, Greedy Eighties, Egregious Eighties* * Or as I dubbed it "Dynasty with lizard makeup and laser guns." Then the newborns: 1990s - The Naughty Nineties2000s - The Decade From Hell (per TIME magazine, ca. 1990)**2010s - The Tensies ** The 2000s could be called "the TwentiOs." There's a Facebook fan page for it, and the logo is a Cheerio. Personally, I called it "that shitty decade that started out with so much promise like Fry's Turkish Delight chocolate but ended up about never-ending war and bottomless economic funk." Future nominations from me (and purely me): 2020s - The Twatties2030s - The Dirties Will the names get recycled? Likely: Mirror Online. Thanks for the A2A. What painful nostalgia. (Source: various, including my own blog)

The ’00s were refered to as the “aught” years , an archaic term for zero. The 1900's or nineteen aught ‘s (between1899 to 1910) were also refered to as the nineteen hundreds, which becomes more ambiguous now that we are well into the 2000's. That reference seems to imply the entire century. For the ’10s decade use “teens”, but “tens" is equally correct and acceptable. It may sound ackward when refering to the nineteen teens or the twenty teens. The term “teens” seems to disclude eleven 11 and twelve 12 , numbers we have kept from a base twelve system... unique numbers that remain likely due to our method of tracking the flow of entropy that we name time.
